page.title: 15The Pole Fair, Corby.
page.content: The Pole Fair was held in 1985 to celebrate the 400th. anniversary of the granting of a Royal Charter to Corbei by Queen Elizabeth 1st. Corbei, as it was originally known, is derived from the Danish for Raven- a large black bird and the town's coat of arms bear this symbol. The Pole Fair is normally held only every twenty years so this year's event was a special one. The old village is the place where it is held and is closed off for the day. Activites associated with a medieaval fair are held, culminating in the roasting of an oxen in the evening. A tug of war is held over the brook and stocks and a whipping post are used for people who do not pay fines to charities. The charter is read at the town boundaries and there is a greasy pole with a goose on top which people try to climb.
